intro: Eremocallis glomerata, commonly known as the clustered daylily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a fan-like pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Eremocallis glomerata is well-suited for gardens and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
